key_points: Garret Miller was arrested on charges related to his involvement in the U.S. Capitol riots on January 6, 2021.
At the time of his arrest, Miller was wearing a T-shirt that said 'Take America Back' and 'I Was There, Washington D.C., January 6, 2021'.
Prosecutors are requesting that Miller remain jailed while awaiting trial, citing the incriminating nature of his T-shirt and social media posts.
Miller documented his actions during the Capitol siege on social media, admitting to entering the Capitol building.
He also made threatening statements towards Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and a Capitol police officer on social media.
Miller is accused of wanting to disrupt the democratic process by bringing tactical gear, ropes, and a gun to the Capitol.
He faced a federal magistrate judge in Texas and has been ordered to remain detained after his January 20 arrest.
On February 12, a grand jury indicted Miller on 12 counts, including civil disorder and assaulting officers.
Miller's attorney has requested his release, arguing he has no history of violence and expressed regret for his actions.
Miller remains in jail in Oklahoma City after an injury, delaying his transport to Washington for trial.
